data.title: Clean living
data.text: The freshest and healthiest things for your body in the Boston area.  It's known for its delicious cold pressed juices.  These are pricey.   There is greater value in the salads, like the quinoa balls, the Greek salad, and the cashews with curry.   Good value in the sandwiches too, like hummus and cranberry, or kale with almond butter.  Conveniently located on City Hall Plaza near the government center T station.

data.title: Acai bowls, pure and natural
data.text: We just loved the pure and natural offerings at this little place. It is a swing by and pick up place but the acai bowls were absolutely delicious - probably the best we have eaten in mainland USA. Yes it is a bit pricey but you gee t what you pay for in the wholefoods space so I didn't complain particularly after I tried it. Nice escape from fast food in the city.

data.title: Good vegan sandwiches, a bit pricey
data.text:
Found via web search while on business nearby. Impressive menu with a decent selection of grab n go sandwich and juice/smoothie options. 

Sandwiches were carefully pre-packed and fresh (per the menu, they only make so many of each per day, so some items may run out). 
The kale/almond hummus/sundried tomato was a little dry; tomato/spinach/cashew spread was fine. 

Smoothies are nice and thick--bring a straw (or a fork!)

Price wise, wasn't thrilled to spend $30 on two sandwiches and a bottled smoothie, but par for the course given location and fresh ingredients.

data.title: Great for Vegans!
data.text: So love Cocobeet for vegan take out. I have become a frequent visitor here & usually buy their juices or smoothies regularly. My favorites are the Green Monkey & Forbidden Juice. They also have lots of other vegan options that are delicious like macaroni & "cheese". Their desserts are really difficult to resist with my favorite being the coconut truffles & chocolate mousse. Wait staff are super friendly & helpful about option.

data.title: Not very impressive!
data.text: The sandwiches smell stale. I ordered one with avocados and was totally disappointed. Not to forget they are quite pricey! Didn't work for me.

data.title: Super fresh & delicious
data.text: Found Cocobeet on search for healthy veggi / vegan breakfast whilst in Boston.  Happy to make a morning walk 1.5miles in the drizzle to get there from hotel as hoping was worth it.... Had the warm quinoa bowl.  It terms of food it definitely was what it says on the web, the only down side is if your plan is to chill out & sit down there whilst eating!! ... Unfortunately the only place to sit is on 2 benches in the window :-( shame as think they could use some of the place for an actual seated bar type area.   Maybe should say about the lack of seating this on their website?!

data.title: Really great healthy food with gluten free options!
data.text:
Very small place, but so glad we found it.  Wish we would have found it earlier in our visit.  We were actually looking for a place to pick up some healthy food for out road trip to Montreal the next day.

We picked up a Key Lime Tart with a berry sauce for dessert that night.  With avocado as the first ingredient you felt like you were eating so healthy.  It was very delicious!  

Everything there is organic and I believe most are gluten free, dairy free  with vegan options as well.

For the ride we picked up a quinoa burger on arugula with a side of spicy almond spread and I think it was a lemon salad dressing.  The quinoa burgers were so amazing that I am hoping to figure out how to make them.  We also got a blue coconut juice that has blueberry, almond butter, almonds, filtered water, coconut oil, chia seeds, and dates.  I believe they even make their own almond milk.  We also had a green magic juice that had cucumber, kale, spinach, romaine, parsley, lime, and spirulina in it.  Again really good. They had many smoothies and juices to select from.

They had a wonderful bean chili that we tried a sample of and if we hadn't had dinner already would have gotten that as well. They are more than willing to let you try samples of their juices which is quite nice.

The customer service was perfect and I would definitely recommend them.  Wish we had one in the Phoenix area!

data.title: Fresh juices and healthy fare
data.text: There are no tables - just benches at the window and all juices, smoothies and food are pre-prepared and in the fridges. Take advantage of their free samples as you decide what juice or smoothie to choose. We loved the quinoa patties (amazing sauce!), the nori rolls and the halva dessert.  Wonderful concept and execution with super friendly service!!

data.title: If only my hometown had a Cocobeet
data.text:
Happily stumbled upon this guilt-free gem whilst attending 'Boston Calling' 2014, and frequented it everyday - sometimes more than once - for the duration of my trip.

Regretably I didn't sample anything from the food menu, but the freshly made juices and smoothies were divine, with favourites including 'Blue Coconut', 'Happy Day', 'Kale Karma', 'Kickstart' and 'Watermelon Quench'.

A little pricey but worth every penny, a true god-send for the health conscious.

data.title: Healthy and Delicious!
data.text:
I had the pleasure of doing a 3 day juice cleanse from Cocobeet. The drinks are excellent and felt extremely healthy as well! I had 6 per day plus a morning shot. One day the morning shot was coconut milk, and
 the other 2 days the shots were beet. I am an avid juicer, I typically make my own, but I wanted a juice cleanse after the holidays. The cleanse GREAT! I feel amazing as I am now in my 4th day and my cleasne has ended. I feel so alive! It was so well worth it. I also had the pleasure of speaking with the owner Onur. He was so polite and helful. He made sure he wrote the days and times of each juice on every single juice for me, as well as emailed me as well. WHAT AMAZING CUSTOMER SERIVE IS THAT! Not only was it awesome customer service, the juices was AWESOME, AND they delivered it to me!!! Thanks again Cocobeet! You guys are excellent!

data.title: Healthy and delicious
data.text: Everything I've tried from Cocobeet has been delicious, and I always feel good about what I'm putting in my body.  It is a bit pricy though, so I reserve for a  teat.  The Vanilla Berry Chia Pudding and Kickstart (beet, carrot, apple and ginger juice) are my favorites!

data.title: Always good to find a vegan takeout spot
data.text:
Found Cocobeet on Happy Cow and popped in for lunch on a Sunday. (After my hubby had his "chowdah!" 

I had a curried chickpea salad and a nice side of veggie cakes. Awesome. Did not want it to end. Thought about getting something for the long drive back to Philly.  

Ate right inside on the small benches by the window. If I lived in Boston, I'd be broke spending $$$ here on food and juices.

data.title: Superb Products, Great Staff
data.text: My wife and I looked up CocoBeet today after flying into Boston for a conference. We are familiar with the vegan/raw/fresh concept, as we live in NYC and frequent similar shops. The products here are excellent - on a par with anything you will find in NYC, with a great range - and they will also make to order. The staff were friendly and helpful, happy to take time to explain everything to us - and they deliver! Like any high quality foods of this type, the products are not cheap - but they ARE worth the money.

data.title: Delicious take away
data.text: Amazing vegan food for take away! Tried it for the first time, and simply loved it! Smoothies are beyond delicious, had avocado hummus sandwich which was OK, and chickpea salad: mouthwatering... Dessert: vegan cheese cake... Everything was heavenly...

data.title: Cold Pressed Juices
data.text: We're staying in Beacon Hill and were so excited to find Cocobeet.  We stocked our fridge for the trip.  The watermelon juice is my favorite so far, but I'm still sampling their flavors.

data.title: Boston's newest vegan to go
data.text: While in Boston eating wonderful Italian meals in the North End we decided to clean the diet up a bit during breakfast and lunch and stumbled upon a small take out place near the government center that specializes in a selection of raw and vegetarian sandwiches and salads, smoothies and juices. Not only do the sandwiches, salads and juices taste great but they're made of mostly local organic ingredients and taste awesome! We stopped by at breakfast time and I ordered the quinoa breakfast cereal consisting of quinoa, almonds, berries, maple and cashew mylk and my husband had the same with granola instead of quinoa. Both were great! The owner is knowledgeable and the juices are great. If you live in Boston and want to do a juice detox this would be the place to go. Very tasty, fresh juices!

data.title: So fresh, so tasty...Please open more locations!
data.text: I was visiting from out of town for a conference (I live in the NYC area), and stumbled across this store. I tried a juice and thought Yum! Loved it so much that I kept trying more...tried about 5 different juices and then also bought some of the food and snacks. Everything tasted so fresh and clean...I totally get why people were coming in and stocking up on bags full of the stuff. My favorites were the Blue Coconut smoothie, the Quinoa Burger, and the chocolate coconut truffles--so good. Owner was very nice and helpful as well--answered all my questions and seemed to know all the "regulars" by first name. Hope they expand into New York City!

data.title: CIBO solo TAKE AWAY
data.text:
Questo è l'unico posto a Boston dove troverete quello che mangia un vegano vero in Italia..ovvero insalatone con quinoa,avocado e verdure varie..
Ottimi sono i sandwiches già pronti da asporto..noi prendavamo il pranzo e lo mangiavamo in giro,non cè da sedersi e nemmeno il bagno.
Ci sono anche molti succhi di frutta.

Passate per un assaggio.
